page.title: 07GEDNEY CHURCH END SCHOOL 1
page.content: ]This school was built about 1862 by the then vicar of Gedney , William Rogers . It was added to in 1876 and various additions and improvements have been made since . Until just after the second World War children came here until they left school at 14 years of age . Now children come as " rising five's " and leave before their twelfth birthday . Pupils then go to the Peele County Secondary School in Long Sutton or , after selection examination , to the Spalding Boys' Grammar School or the Spalding Girls' High School. There are about 70 children at Gedney Church End School and there are three teachers . Until 1967 there was a school in Gedney Dyke but this was closed when numbers on roll fell and the children from that village now travel on a bus
